ygData.subject: RE: [eqbards] Numbers on Bards
ygData.msgSnippet: Ok, so last night we got to Kith to kill a couple Generals. Our pally who has just gotten the dmg 2 delay 6 poker from PoS seems to have gotten the full
ygData.messageBody:
Ok, so last night we got to Kith to kill a couple Generals.

Our pally who has just gotten the dmg 2 delay 6 poker from PoS seems to have
gotten the full attention of the Generalisimo. I am on my cleric and
/assisting the mob while watching my group's bars. The pally - not in my
group - starts to drop at a fast rate. I figger he's got his own cleric but
a remedy wont hurt. As fast as I can drop a rememdy on him he's dropping off
again. So I chain cast another. Then say screw that and chain cast a divine
lite. Then 3 more divine lites.

He lives!!! After the fight, in /gu I find out that 2 other clerics were
doing the same thing: chain casting divine light/remedys - heh. So, yeah,
different spells for different situations.

Sylly


-----Original Message-----
From: Garramone, Michael (CCI-Las Vegas)
[mailto:garramone@...]
Sent: Thursday, January 18, 2001 5:09 PM
To: 'eqbards@egroups.com'
Subject: RE: [eqbards] Numbers on Bards


complete heal is the most powerful spell in the game. but obviously a
cleric needs to know how to use it along with their other heals effectively.

Shada, 58 Bard
Afterlife
